common

Interface ICmd2ModelAdapter<S,M extends IMessageType>

  • Type Parameters:
    S - the target recipient type in method sendTo()
    M - The message type (must extends IMessageType)
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ICRCmd2ModelAdapter, ILocalCmd2ModelAdapter, IServerCRCmd2ModelAdapter, IServerUser2ModelAdapter, IServerUserCmd2ModelAdapter, IUser2ModelAdapter, IUserCmd2ModelAdapter
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ServerCRCmd2ModelAdapter

    public interface ICmd2ModelAdapter<S,M extends IMessageType>
    This adapter is for the externally-sourced commands to interact with the local system

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void appendMsg(java.lang.String text, java.lang.String name)
      Append some message to the model, allowing the model to process the message by itself.
      void buildNonScrollableComponent(IComponentFactory fac, java.lang.String label)
      Give the GUI a factory that creates a non-scrollable component component to add.
      void buildScrollableComponent(IComponentFactory fac, java.lang.String label)
      Give the GUI a factory that creates a scrollable component component to add.
      <T> T get(MixedDataKey<T> key)
      Get the value associated with the given key from the local data storage(IMixedDataDictionary) Note that the local data storage(IMixedDataDictionary) is designed to be per-application.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Get the name of the local user.
      <T> T put(MixedDataKey<T> key, T value)
      Put a value into the local data storage(IMixedDataDictionary), associated with the given key, replacing any value already in the dictionary that is already associated with the key.

      void      		 sendTo(S target, java.lang.Class<T> id, T data)
      Send a data packet to a target recipient.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Get the name of the local user.
        Returns:
        the name of the local user

      • appendMsg

        void appendMsg(java.lang.String text,
               java.lang.String name)
        Append some message to the model, allowing the model to process the message by itself. Typically the model just appends to the view.
        Parameters:
        text - The message
        name - The name of the person sending the text

      • buildScrollableComponent

        void buildScrollableComponent(IComponentFactory fac,
                              java.lang.String label)
        Give the GUI a factory that creates a scrollable component component to add. Some components that are added are considered by the system to be just fancy displays of message contents and in such, just like text messages, are desired to be placed on some sort of scrolling display.
        Parameters:
        fac - The factory to create the desired component
        label - The identifying label for the scrollable component on the GUI

      • buildNonScrollableComponent

        void buildNonScrollableComponent(IComponentFactory fac,
                                 java.lang.String label)
        Give the GUI a factory that creates a non-scrollable component component to add. Some components that are added are actually static modifications of the local GUI to present additional user interaction capabilities. It would be undesireable for these components to scroll off the screen as other messages arrive; they should have a fixed location on the local GUI.
        Parameters:
        fac - the factory to create the desired component
        label - The identifying label for the non-scrollable component on the GUI

      • put

        <T> T put(MixedDataKey<T> key,
          T value)
        Put a value into the local data storage(IMixedDataDictionary), associated with the given key, replacing any value already in the dictionary that is already associated with the key. Note that the local data storage(IMixedDataDictionary) is designed to be per-application.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of data being put in
        Parameters:
        key - the key to use to find the value
        value - The value to associate with the key
        Returns:
        The previous value associated with the key or null if there was none.

      • get

        <T> T get(MixedDataKey<T> key)
        Get the value associated with the given key from the local data storage(IMixedDataDictionary) Note that the local data storage(IMixedDataDictionary) is designed to be per-application.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of data being retrieved
        Parameters:
        key - the key to use
        Returns:
        The value associated with the key or null if there is no entry for the key.

      • sendTo

        <T extends M> void sendTo(S target,
                          java.lang.Class<T> id,
                          T data)
        Send a data packet to a target recipient.
        Parameters:
        target - the target recipient
        id - the class id, i.e. message type
        data - the data
